conclusion: To determine how many moments in the interval [0, 4] seconds the particle's speed is 5 m/s, we need to analyze the given displacement-time graph and find the points where the slope (which represents the speed) equals 5 m/s.

To find the speed at any point, we need to take the derivative of the position function with respect to time, which gives us the velocity function.
Since the exact functional form of x(t) is not provided, we use the concept of the slope of the tangent line at various points.
The slope of the tangent line at any point on the graph gives the instantaneous speed of the particle at that point.
